title: Graduate Digital Program of Study
description: Developed software to provide over 3,500 graduate students tools for their Program of Study using the Salesforce platform.

bullets.point: Designed a kanban-style degree planner for students connected to a database of hundereds of courses.
Automated requirements checking giving the student instant feedback on their course selection.
Featured automatic PDF generation saving students and staff time by eliminating the need for hand-written forms.
Consolidated the need from 10 different paper forms to a component based, extensible system for digital form generation.
Tailored the system to meet the requirements of over 80 unique graduate programs.

title: Graduate Application Notifier
description: Migrated an existing legacy process used to notify university graduate faculty of newly submitted graduate applications to Salesforce.

bullets.point: Used the MVC and OOP design patterns to maintain code organization, maintainability and ease of use.
Created a unit test suite to completely cover the project well past the platform required 75% line coverage.
Automated the sorting of hundreds of student applications and routed via email to faculty and staff specified subscriptions.
Scheduled the porcess to run automatically every day, staying within the platform's governor limits.

title: Peerist Web App
description: Developed a web application to facilitate feedback gathering for Academic Writers.

bullets.point: Coordinated requirements gathering for our development team and our client.
Designed database schema using the Hasura GraphQL engine, Postgres, Docker, and a front-end using React.

title: Code Editor, Elementary OS
employer: Work in Progress Open Source Contribution
description: Implemented Git-diff style line change markers to the Code editor included in the Elementary OS Linux distribution.

title: Code Editor, Elementary OS
description: Added a status indicator for text searching to the Code editor included in the Elementary OS Linux distribution. Change was requested by a user with difficulty seeing red and green colors. Used Vala (similar to Java) to complete the change.

title: CLI, QMK Firmware
description: Contributed to a CLI tool using Python to assist users flashing mechanical keyboard firmware. Changes also included documentation written in Markdown and unit tests.
